description: Rada Miskovic, using state media credentials and covert analog channels, releases a comprehensive leak: the algorithms and decision criteria behind individual BCI scores are shared with citizen networks.

Citizens access personal BCI rationale via terminals and flyers, discovering biased scoring logic and unfair behavioral triggers. Small groups gather at terminal hubs to discuss and verify disclosures.

BCI terminals citywide display live feedback disclosing reasons, disputed flags, and behavioral triggers for all scores. Outrage spreads as crowds debate limitations and form plans for collective protests.
Neighborhood groups unite to challenge their BCI scores, organizing public forums and support networks. They demand justice for those flagged unfairly, amplifying calls for systemic reform.

Under pressure from mass unrest, the Council halts automated BCI enforcement in key areas and reverts to manual oversight. Grassroots assemblies emerge as power shifts from automated control toward citizen-led demands for transparency and change.
